page.title: 11Brixton School
page.content: The school was built in 1843 and a extra room added after the 1870 education act.In 1977 a temporary classroom was added in an old garden. In the main building are 3 main rooms. The hall is 9.3x5.8m and two classrooms 6.5x5.5m The headmasters house is attached to the school but is no longer occupied.It is used for a headmasters office, resource room, staff room / TV room / library and stock room.The kitchen is used for our own cookery lessons and the bathroom is a P.E store.We have a small swimming pool.The toilets are out side in the yard.The play ground is on land owned by the village.The school was founded by the church of England who still own the building and appoint some Governors.We hope to have a new school in 1986.
